sentence: Why did the gifting company fire their last employee ? because they got a bad wrap.
explanation: 1. A wrap can refer to a type of food, such as a tortilla filled with various ingredients. 2. To wrap something means to cover or enclose it in paper or another material.
first_new_sentence: She ordered a chicken wrap for lunch.
second_new_sentence: They decided to wrap the present in colorful paper for the birthday party.

sentence: What does the murderer say after he kills someone with a nail gun? nailed it.
explanation: 1. Nailed can mean to fasten or secure something with nails. 2. To nail it is a phrase used to indicate that something has been done successfully.
first_new_sentence: He nailed the board to the wall to hang the picture.
second_new_sentence: She nailed the presentation and received great feedback.

sentence: Will I have an open casket at my funeral? remains to be seen.
explanation: 1. Remains refer to what is left or what is left behind after a part is taken or lost, often associated with deceased bodies. 2. Remains can also refer to something that is leftover or what continues to exist.
first_new_sentence: The archaeologists uncovered the remains of an ancient civilization.
second_new_sentence: After finishing the cake, all that remains is the empty plate.
